sourceMeaningMnemonic: I always <radical>say</radical> the <radical>fruit</radical> <kanji>section</kanji> at the grocery should be at the front of the store. It’s the perfect place for the fruit section, I say.
meaningInfo: Think about it. Every grocery store has the fruit section right at the front, wouldn’t you say?
readingMnemonic: To get to the fruit <kanji>section</kanji>, you have to go to the store. To get to the store you have to drive a <reading>ca</reading>r (<ja>か</ja>). Driving a car is the fastest way to get to the fruit section at the store.
readingInfo: Picture yourself driving a car and salivating over the fruit waiting for you in the fruit section. Imagine your favorite fruit as you put the pedal to the metal in your awesome car.
